item.title: 美国关键就业数据公布前市场人心惶惶
item.description: 周五，亚洲股市在狭窄的区间内徘徊，美元则收跌，投资者在美国就业数据公布前惶惶不可终日，这些数据可能决定全球最大经济体未来降息的规模和速度。【原文：Asian shares clung to tight ranges and the dollar nursed losses on Friday, with investors on tenterhooks ahead of U.S. jobs data that could decide the size and speed of coming rate cuts in the world's largest economy.】

item.title: 随着整合步伐加快，中国打造出价值 2300 亿美元的经纪业巨头
item.description: 分析师说，中国两家国有券商的合并将产生一个拥有 2,300 亿美元资产的行业领导者，这是中国政府在充满挑战的市场环境中整合这个价值 17 亿美元的行业的努力的一部分，而且这一举措将加快步伐。【原文：The merger of two state-backed brokerages in China to create a sector leader with $230 billion in assets is part of Beijing's drive to consolidate the $1.7-trillion industry amid challenging markets, and the move is set to gather pace, analysts said.】

item.title: 美国原油库存减少，欧佩克+推迟增产，石油价格持稳
item.description: 周五早盘，油价略有上涨，原因是投资者权衡了美国原油库存大幅下降和欧佩克+产油国推迟增产的因素，以及喜忧参半的美国就业数据。【原文：Oil prices edged up in early trading on Friday as investors weighed a big withdrawal from U.S. crude inventories and a delay to production hikes by OPEC+ producers against mixed U.S. employment data.】

item.title: 美国起诉后，YouTube 终止特尼特媒体频道
item.description: 在美国司法部提出起诉后，Alphabet 旗下的 YouTube 周四表示，将终止 Tenet Media 频道和由 Tenet 所有者劳伦-陈（Lauren Chen）运营的四个频道。【原文：Alphabet's YouTube said on Thursday it was terminating the Tenet Media channel and four channels operated by Tenet owner Lauren Chen, following an indictment from the U.S. Department of Justice.】

item.title: 美元跌至一周低点，非农测试迫在眉睫
item.description: 周五，美元兑主要货币汇率跌至一周低点附近，就业市场指标发出的信号好坏参半，稍后公布的月度就业数据几乎肯定会为美联储的宽松政策定调。【原文：The U.S. dollar sagged near a one-week low versus major peers on Friday with job market indicators sending mixed signals ahead of crucial monthly payrolls data later in the day that is almost certain to set the pace for Federal Reserve policy easing.】

item.title: Seven & i 称 Couche-Tard 每股 14.86 美元的报价不够充分
item.description: 日本零售巨头 Seven & I Holdings 周五表示，加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司提出以每股 14.86 美元的现金收购该公司，但该公司以不符合股东利益为由拒绝了这一提议。【原文：Japanese retail giant Seven & I Holdings said on Friday Canada's Alimentation Couche-Tard had offered to buy the company for $14.86 per share in cash, but it rejected the proposal as not being in the interest of shareholders.】

item.title: 日本 7 月家庭支出增长，逊于预期
item.description: 日本政府周五公布的数据显示，7 月份日本家庭支出增幅低于预期，原因是面对物价上涨，消费者对放松银根仍持谨慎态度。【原文：Japanese household spending rose less than expected in July, government data showed on Friday, as consumers remained wary of loosening their purse strings in the face of higher prices.】

item.title: 阿根廷分析师下调 2024 年通胀预期至近 123
item.description: 阿根廷央行周四公布的一项民意调查显示，阿根廷 8 月份的月通胀率为 3.9%，预计今年年底的年化通胀率将接近 123%。【原文：Argentina's monthly inflation rate stood at 3.9% in August and is expected to close the year at an annualized rate of nearly 123%, according to analysts surveyed by the central bank in a poll published on Thursday.】

item.title: 纽约州新法规定大型零售商必须安装紧急按钮
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）周四签署了一项新法律，要求零售商加强对店员的安全保护，包括要求大型连锁店在纽约州所有分店增加紧急按钮。【原文：New York Governor Kathy Hochul on Thursday signed a new law requiring retailers to boost safety protections for store workers, including requiring major chains to add panic buttons in all New York State locations.】

item.title: 报告称英国经济增长需要额外 1.3 万亿美元投资
item.description: 周五的一份报告称，英国需要在未来十年追加一万亿英镑（1.3 万亿美元）的投资，以实现经济增长。【原文：Britain needs an additional one trillion pounds ($1.3 trillion) in investment in the next decade to grow the economy, a report said on Friday.】

item.title: 早间竞价：震荡周结束，日元寻求突破
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 资金短缺的消费者让澳大利亚酒类制造商头疼不已
item.description: 由于澳大利亚长期的生活成本危机导致越来越多的人减少饮酒，最近的销售下滑意味着悉尼酒类专卖店店主路易丝-道林（Louise Dowling）不得不每周增加 40 个小时的工作时间，以弥补她不得不解雇的员工。【原文：A recent slump in sales means Sydney liquor store owner Louise Dowling has to work an additional 40 hours a week to make up for the staff she had to let go, as a prolonged cost of living crisis in Australia drives more people to drink less.】

item.title: 底特律谈判陷入僵局，卡车司机罢工可能扩大到马拉松其他炼油厂
item.description: 卡车司机协会周四表示，自 200 多名工人罢工以来，马拉松石油公司一直不愿与底特律炼油厂的工会成员进行谈判，并补充说，这一工业行动可能会扩大到这家美国最大的独立炼油公司的其他工厂。【原文：Marathon Petroleum has been unwilling to negotiate with union members at its Detroit refinery since more than 200 workers went on strike, Teamsters said on Thursday, adding that the industrial action could be extended to the largest U.S. independent refiner's other plants.】

item.title: 日经新闻》报道：丰田、日产将扩大日本电池产能
item.description: 据《日经新闻》周五报道，丰田汽车、日产汽车和其他公司将在政府的支持下，通过总计 1 万亿日元（69.7 亿美元）的投资，帮助日本将蓄电池产能扩大约 50%。【原文：Toyota Motor , Nissan Motor and other companies will help expand Japanese production capacity for storage batteries by around 50% with government support through a total investment of 1 trillion yen ($6.97 billion), the Nikkei reported on Friday.】

item.title: Salesforce 将以 19 亿美元收购数据保护提供商 Own Company
item.description: Salesforce 周四表示，将以 19 亿美元现金收购数据保护和数据管理解决方案提供商 Own Company。【原文：Salesforce said on Thursday it would buy Own Company, a provider of data protection and data management solutions, for $1.9 billion in cash.】

item.title: 红龙虾出售给 Fortress 获得法院批准
item.description: 连锁餐厅 Red Lobster 周四获得法院批准进行重组，这将使该公司在以 Fortress 投资集团为首的贷款人联盟的掌控下摆脱破产。【原文：Restaurant chain Red Lobster on Thursday received court approval for a restructuring that will allow the company to emerge from bankruptcy under the ownership of a Fortress Investment Group-led coalition of lenders.】

item.title: 博通第三季度营收超出预期
item.description: 芯片制造商博通公司（Broadcom）周四公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期，主要原因是其用于人工智能应用的网络和定制芯片需求旺盛。【原文：Chipmaker Broadcom beat Wall Street expectations for third-quarter revenue on Thursday, driven by demand for its networking and custom chips used in artificial intelligence applications.】

item.title: 好时攻击针对产品包装的诉讼，寻求终结里斯案
item.description: 好时（Hershey）公司敦促美国法官驳回其声称在几款里斯（Reese's）花生酱糖果上误导消费者的诉讼，并利用其请求对其认为毫无根据的有关产品包装的集体诉讼进行了抨击。【原文：Hershey urged a U.S. judge to dismiss a lawsuit claiming it misled consumers about several Reese's peanut butter candies, using its request to level a broadside against what it considers baseless class action litigation over product packaging.】

item.title: 亚马逊在工会选举诉讼中挑战美国劳工委员会的结构
item.description: 亚马逊公司周四提起诉讼，指控美国劳工委员会非法干预纽约市一家仓库的工会选举，并声称该机构的结构违反了美国宪法。【原文：Amazon.com filed a lawsuit on Thursday accusing a U.S. labor board of illegally interfering in a union election at a New York City warehouse and claiming the agency's structure violates the U.S. Constitution.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州天然气厂提案被拒绝在州融资计划之外
item.description: 德克萨斯州的文件显示，德克萨斯州能源监管机构在将一家拟建发电厂列为该州一项旨在推广天然气发电的新计划的入围项目几天后，拒绝了该发电厂的公共资金申请。【原文：Texas energy regulators have denied public funding requests for a proposed power plant days after naming the project as a finalist for a new state program aimed at building out natural gas-fired electricity generation, state documents show.】

item.title: 特朗普会如何试图瓦解拜登的气候遗产？
item.description: 有希望当选总统的唐纳德-特朗普提出了一项能源政策纲领，其核心是最大限度地提高美国的燃料和电力产出，其部分手段是废除拜登政府应对气候变化的核心努力。【原文：Presidential hopeful Donald Trump has laid out an energy policy platform centered around maximizing U.S. fuel and power output, in part by dismantling the Biden administration’s centerpiece efforts to fight climate change.】

item.title: 美国呼吁大型科技公司帮助躲避俄罗斯和伊朗的网络审查员
item.description: 为了说服美国科技巨头为政府资助的互联网审查规避工具提供更多数字带宽，白宫周四与亚马逊、Alphabet 旗下谷歌、微软、Cloudflare 等公司的代表举行了一次会议。【原文：The White House, aiming to persuade U.S. tech giants to offer more digital bandwidth for government-funded internet censorship evasion tools, held a meeting with representatives of Amazon.com , Alphabet's Google , Microsoft , Cloudflare and others on Thursday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：举报人指控美国银行与部分投资者共享非公开信息
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，一起举报人投诉称，美国银行在出售印度股票前与一些投资者分享了非公开信息。【原文：A whistleblower complaint has alleged that Bank of America shared nonpublic information with some investors before it sold stock in India, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国劳动力市场健康，尽管招聘步伐放缓
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周四表示，尽管最近几个月创造就业的步伐有所放缓，但美国仍然拥有一个 "良好健康的劳动力市场"。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Thursday that the U.S. still has a "good healthy labor market" even though the pace of job creation has slowed in recent months.】

item.title: 独家报道日美钢铁交易后美国担心基础设施用钢供应问题
item.description: 路透社看到，美国在给新日铁和美国钢铁公司的一封信中表示，新日铁拟斥资 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司，这将带来国家安全风险，因为这可能会损害关键运输、基础设施、建筑和农业项目所需的钢材供应。【原文：Nippon Steel's proposed $14.9 billion takeover of U.S. Steel would create national security risks because it could hurt the supply of steel needed for critical transportation, infrastructure, construction and agriculture projects, the U.S. said in a letter sent to the companies and seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 法院禁令冻结 Raiffeisen 银行俄罗斯分支所有权
item.description: 俄罗斯最大的西方银行 Raiffeisen Bank International 周四表示，俄罗斯法院冻结了该银行当地分支机构的股份，暂时排除了出售该业务的可能性。【原文：A Russian court froze the shares in Raiffeisen Bank International's local arm, the biggest Western bank in Russia said on Thursday, ruling out any sale of the business for now.】

item.title: 美联储就紧急贷款行动征求反馈意见
item.description: 美联储周四表示，它正在就如何运作 "贴现窗口 "征求反馈意见，该窗口的目的是在银行面临压力时向其提供紧急贷款。【原文：The Federal Reserve said on Thursday it was seeking feedback on how it operates its "discount window," which is intended to provide emergency lending to banks in times of stress.】

item.title: 墨西哥银行监管机构批准股市改革细节
item.description: 带头进行改革的墨西哥财政部副部长加布里埃尔-约里奥（Gabriel Yorio）说，墨西哥银行监管机构 CNBV 董事会周四批准了去年通过的股市改革条款。【原文：The board of Mexican bank regulator CNBV on Thursday approved the terms of a stock market reform passed last year, Deputy Finance Minister Gabriel Yorio, who spearheaded the reform, said.】

item.title: DOT 命令美国最大的航空公司回答关于飞行常客计划的问题
item.description: 美国交通部周四表示，正在对美国四大航空运营商的奖励和飞行常客计划展开调查，以确保消费者不会遭遇不公平、欺骗性或反竞争行为。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said on Thursday it is opening an inquiry into the four largest U.S. air carrier rewards and frequent flyer programs to ensure consumers do not face unfair, deceptive, or anticompetitive practices.】

item.title: 前英国交易员因奖金纠纷起诉德意志银行败诉
item.description: 德意志银行的一名前交易员因近十年前未获得个人奖金而在伦敦对该银行提起诉讼，最终以 260 多万英镑（340 万美元）败诉。【原文：A former Deutsche Bank trader on Thursday lost her London lawsuit against the bank for just over 2.6 million pounds ($3.4 million) after she was not paid an individual bonus nearly a decade ago.】
